content.raw:
Hello,

I've just installed gazebo5 on Ubuntu 14.04, but I get a segfault when I try to launch gzserver.  Here's the output of gzserver --verbose:


Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 5.3.0

Copyright (C) 2012-2015 Open Source Robotics Foundation.

Released under the Apache 2 License.

http://gazebosim.org


[Msg] Waiting for master.

[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345

[Msg] Publicized address: 10.0.0.3

Segmentation fault (core dumped)


I know that's not a lot to go on.  Does anyone know what could be causing this, or what I can do to produce some more useful information?

Hello,

I've just installed gazebo5 on Ubuntu 14.04, but I get a segfault when I try to launch gzserver. Here's the output of gzserver --verbose:

Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 5.3.0

Copyright (C) 2012-2015 Open Source Robotics Foundation.

Released under the Apache 2 License.

http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.

[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345

[Msg] Publicized address: 10.0.0.3

Segmentation fault (core dumped)

I know that's not a lot to go on. Does anyone know what could be causing this, or what I can do to produce some more useful information?
